channel.title: Ranks in yell

item.title: Ranks in yell
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[code]
if (command.startsWith(“yell”)) {
String msg = command.substring(5);
String rank = “”;

if (muted) {
    sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell.");
    return;
}

switch (playerRights) {
    case 1:
        rank = "Moderator";
    break;

    case 2:
        rank = "Administrator";
    break;

    case 3:
        rank = "Co-Owner";
    break;
}
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Kenshin"))
    rank = "Owner";
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = rank + playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(msg.charAt(0)) + msg.substring(1).toLowerCase();
return;

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Ranks in yell
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:6, topic:274457”]Since you’re sending the message unconditionally, it’s redundant to do so inside of each if statement.

[code]
if (command.startsWith(“yell”)) {
String msg = command.substring(5);
String rank = “”;

if (muted) {
    sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell.");
    return;
}

switch (playerRights) {
    case 1:
        rank = "Moderator";
    break;

    case 2:
        rank = "Administrator";
    break;

    case 3:
        rank = "Owner";
    break;
}
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = rank + playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(msg.charAt(0)) + msg.substring(1).toLowerCase();
return;

}
[/code][/quote][quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:6, topic:274457”]Since you’re sending the message unconditionally, it’s redundant to do so inside of each if statement.

[code]
if (command.startsWith(“yell”)) {
String msg = command.substring(5);
String rank = “”;

if (muted) {
    sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell.");
    return;
}

switch (playerRights) {
    case 1:
        rank = "Moderator";
    break;

    case 2:
        rank = "Administrator";
    break;

    case 3:
        rank = "Owner";
    break;
}
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = rank + playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(msg.charAt(0)) + msg.substring(1).toLowerCase();
return;

}
[/code][/quote]

Alright, well what about it saysing Co-Owner for the playerrights equalling 3… but for playername Kenshin for it to say Owner

cause i have 2 co-owners on my server and i dont want them confused

Read full topic

item.title: Ranks in yell
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Since you’re sending the message unconditionally, it’s redundant to do so inside of each if statement.

if (command.startsWith("yell")) {
    String msg = command.substring(5);
    String rank = "";

    if (muted) {
        sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell.");
        return;
    }

    switch (playerRights) {
        case 1:
            rank = "Moderator";
        break;

        case 2:
            rank = "Administrator";
        break;

        case 3:
            rank = "Owner";
        break;
    }
    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = rank + playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(msg.charAt(0)) + msg.substring(1).toLowerCase();
    return;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Ranks in yell
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

Sarcasm.

The community doesn’t understand how easy creating a else statement is…

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) { String text = command.substring(5); PlayerHandler.messageToAll =playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1) + ""; } else if(playerRights == 1) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll =playerName [MOD] + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1) + ""; } else if(playerRights == 2) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll =playerName [ADMIN] + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1) + ""; } else if(playerRights == 3) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll =playerName [OWNER] + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1) + ""; } else if (muted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and you cannot yell!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Ranks in yell
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I have been trying for about 8 days now to get this to work… i am using reapage souce. I have seen it done many times and would like it myself for those dumb noobs who refuse to admit your owner… Here is the code i have been working with… NOT WHAT I ACUALLY MADE… the one i made acualy blocked people from yelling so i had to take it back out

            if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) {
                String text = command.substring(5);
                PlayerHandler.messageToAll =playerName + ": "
                        + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                        + text.substring(1) + "";
            } else if (muted == 1) {
                sendMessage("You are muted and you cannot yell!");
            }
        }
    }

If you can be of any help of one that has ranks for players… mods… admins… co-owner… and myself (name is Kenshin on server) tht would be great… or even pointers of what i coulda been doing wong

Read full topic
